trans-unit.source: Using the SQL Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the SQL Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the SQL Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the SQL Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Connect to an on-premises SQL Server or an Azure SQL Database to create and change your information or data.
trans-unit.target: Connect to an on-premises SQL Server or an Azure SQL Database to create and change your information or data.

trans-unit.source: Connectors can be used in Logic Apps to retrieve, process, or push data as a part of a "workflow".
trans-unit.target: Connectors can be used in Logic Apps to retrieve, process, or push data as a part of a "workflow".

trans-unit.source: When you use the SQL Connector in your workflow, you can achieve a variety of scenarios.
trans-unit.target: When you use the SQL Connector in your workflow, you can achieve a variety of scenarios.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can:

trans-unit.source: Expose a section of the data residing in your SQL database using a web or mobile application.
trans-unit.target: Expose a section of the data residing in your SQL database using a web or mobile application.

trans-unit.source: Insert data into a SQL database table for storage.
trans-unit.target: Insert data into a SQL database table for storage.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can enter employee records, update sales orders, and so on.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can enter employee records, update sales orders, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Get data from SQL and use it in a business process.
trans-unit.target: Get data from SQL and use it in a business process.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can get customer records and put those customer records in SalesForce.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can get customer records and put those customer records in SalesForce.

trans-unit.source: You can add the SQL Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the SQL Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Triggers are events that happen.
trans-unit.target: Triggers are events that happen.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an order is updated or when a new customer is added.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an order is updated or when a new customer is added.

trans-unit.source: An Action is the result of the trigger.
trans-unit.target: An Action is the result of the trigger.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an order is updated, send an alert to the salesperson.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an order is updated, send an alert to the salesperson.

trans-unit.source: Or, when a new customer is added, send a welcome email to the new customer.
trans-unit.target: Or, when a new customer is added, send a welcome email to the new customer.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Connector can be used as a trigger or an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Connector can be used as a trigger or an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.

trans-unit.source: For every table included in your package settings (more on that later in this topic), there is a set of JSON actions and a set of XML actions.
trans-unit.target: For every table included in your package settings (more on that later in this topic), there is a set of JSON actions and a set of XML actions.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:
trans-unit.target: The SQL Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:

trans-unit.source: Triggers
trans-unit.target: Triggers

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: Poll Data
trans-unit.target: Poll Data

trans-unit.source:
• Insert Into Table
  • Update Table
  • Select From Table
  • Delete From Table
  • Call Stored Procedure
trans-unit.target:
• Insert Into Table
  • Update Table
  • Select From Table
  • Delete From Table
  • Call Stored Procedure

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Search for “SQL Connector”, select it, and select Create.
trans-unit.target: Search for “SQL Connector”, select it, and select Create.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following package settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following package settings:

trans-unit.source: Name | Required | Description --- | --- | --- Server Name | Yes | Enter the SQL Server name.
trans-unit.target: Name | Required | Description --- | --- | --- Server Name | Yes | Enter the SQL Server name.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter SQLserver/sqlexpress or SQLserver.mydomain.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter SQLserver/sqlexpress or SQLserver.mydomain.com.

trans-unit.source: Port | No | Default is 1433.
trans-unit.target: Port | No | Default is 1433.

trans-unit.source: User Name | Yes | Enter a user name that can log into the SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: User Name | Yes | Enter a user name that can log into the SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: If connecting to an on-premises SQL Server, enter SQL Authentication credentials.
trans-unit.target: If connecting to an on-premises SQL Server, enter SQL Authentication credentials.

trans-unit.source: Password | Yes | Enter the user name password.
trans-unit.target: Password | Yes | Enter the user name password.

trans-unit.source: Database Name | Yes | Enter the database you are connecting.
trans-unit.target: Database Name | Yes | Enter the database you are connecting.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can enter Customers or dbo/orders.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can enter Customers or dbo/orders.

trans-unit.source: On-Premises | Yes | Default is False.
trans-unit.target: On-Premises | Yes | Default is False.

trans-unit.source: Enter False if connecting to an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: Enter False if connecting to an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: Enter True if connecting to an on-premises SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Enter True if connecting to an on-premises SQL Server.

trans-unit.source:
Service Bus Connection String | No | If you're connecting to on-premises, enter the Service Bus relay connection string.

Using the Hybrid Connection Manager
Service Bus Pricing Partner Server Name | No | If the primary server is unavailable, you can enter a partner server as an alternate or backup server.
trans-unit.target:
Service Bus Connection String | No | If you're connecting to on-premises, enter the Service Bus relay connection string.

Using the Hybrid Connection Manager
Service Bus Pricing Partner Server Name | No | If the primary server is unavailable, you can enter a partner server as an alternate or backup server.

trans-unit.source: Tables | No | List the database tables that can be updated by the connector.
trans-unit.target: Tables | No | List the database tables that can be updated by the connector.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter OrdersTable or EmployeeTable.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter OrdersTable or EmployeeTable.

trans-unit.source: If no tables are entered, all tables can be used.
trans-unit.target: If no tables are entered, all tables can be used.

trans-unit.source: Valid tables and/or Stored Procedures are required to use this connector as an action.
trans-unit.target: Valid tables and/or Stored Procedures are required to use this connector as an action.

trans-unit.source: Stored Procedures | No | Enter an existing stored procedure that can be called by the connector.
trans-unit.target: Stored Procedures | No | Enter an existing stored procedure that can be called by the connector.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter sp_IsEmployeeEligible or sp_CalculateOrderDiscount.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter sp_IsEmployeeEligible or sp_CalculateOrderDiscount.

trans-unit.source: Valid tables and/or Stored Procedures are required to use this connector as an action.
trans-unit.target: Valid tables and/or Stored Procedures are required to use this connector as an action.

trans-unit.source: Data Available Query | For trigger support | SQL statement to determine whether any data is available for polling a SQL Server database table.
trans-unit.target: Data Available Query | For trigger support | SQL statement to determine whether any data is available for polling a SQL Server database table.

trans-unit.source: This should return a numeric value representing the number of rows of data available.
trans-unit.target: This should return a numeric value representing the number of rows of data available.

trans-unit.source: Example: SELECT COUNT(*) from table_name.
trans-unit.target: Example: SELECT COUNT(*) from table_name.

trans-unit.source: Poll Data Query | For trigger support | The SQL statement to poll the SQL Server database table.
trans-unit.target: Poll Data Query | For trigger support | The SQL statement to poll the SQL Server database table.

trans-unit.source: You can enter any number of SQL statements separated by a semicolon.
trans-unit.target: You can enter any number of SQL statements separated by a semicolon.

trans-unit.source: This statement is executed transactionally and only committed when the data is safely stored in your logic app.
trans-unit.target: This statement is executed transactionally and only committed when the data is safely stored in your logic app.

trans-unit.source: Example: SELECT * FROM tablename; DELETE FROM tablename.
trans-unit.target: Example: SELECT * FROM tablename; DELETE FROM tablename.

trans-unit.source:
Note
You must provide a poll statement that avoids an infinite loop by deleting, moving or updating selected data to ensure that same data isn't polled again.
trans-unit.target:
Note
You must provide a poll statement that avoids an infinite loop by deleting, moving or updating selected data to ensure that same data isn't polled again.

trans-unit.source: When complete, the Package Settings look similar to the following: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: When complete, the Package Settings look similar to the following: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Create.
trans-unit.target: Select Create.

trans-unit.source: Let's look at a simple logic app that polls data from a SQL table, adds the data in another table, and updates the data.
trans-unit.target: Let's look at a simple logic app that polls data from a SQL table, adds the data in another table, and updates the data.

trans-unit.source: To use the SQL connector as a trigger, enter the Data Available Query and Poll Data Query values.
trans-unit.target: To use the SQL connector as a trigger, enter the Data Available Query and Poll Data Query values.

trans-unit.source: Data Available Query is executed on the schedule you enter and determines if any data is available.
trans-unit.target: Data Available Query is executed on the schedule you enter and determines if any data is available.

trans-unit.source: Since this query only returns a scalar number, it can be tuned and optimized for frequent execution.
trans-unit.target: Since this query only returns a scalar number, it can be tuned and optimized for frequent execution.

trans-unit.source: Poll Data Query is only executed when the Data Available Query indicates that data is available.
trans-unit.target: Poll Data Query is only executed when the Data Available Query indicates that data is available.

trans-unit.source: This statement executes within a transaction and is only committed when the extracted data is durably stored in your workflow.
trans-unit.target: This statement executes within a transaction and is only committed when the extracted data is durably stored in your workflow.

trans-unit.source: It is important to avoid infinitely re-extracting the same data.
trans-unit.target: It is important to avoid infinitely re-extracting the same data.

trans-unit.source: The transactional nature of this execution can be used to delete or update the data to ensure it isn't collected the next time data is queried.
trans-unit.target: The transactional nature of this execution can be used to delete or update the data to ensure it isn't collected the next time data is queried.

trans-unit.source: The schema returned by this statement identifies the available properties in your connector.
trans-unit.target: The schema returned by this statement identifies the available properties in your connector.

trans-unit.source: All columns must be named.
trans-unit.target: All columns must be named.

trans-unit.source: When creating or editing a logic app, select the SQL Connector you created as the trigger.
trans-unit.target: When creating or editing a logic app, select the SQL Connector you created as the trigger.

trans-unit.source: This lists the available triggers: Poll Data (JSON) and Poll Data (XML):
trans-unit.target: This lists the available triggers: Poll Data (JSON) and Poll Data (XML):

trans-unit.source: Select the Poll Data (JSON) trigger, enter the frequency, and click the ✓:
trans-unit.target: Select the Poll Data (JSON) trigger, enter the frequency, and click the ✓:

trans-unit.source: The trigger now appears as configured in the logic app.
trans-unit.target: The trigger now appears as configured in the logic app.

trans-unit.source: The output(s) of the trigger are shown and can be used as inputs in any subsequent actions: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: The output(s) of the trigger are shown and can be used as inputs in any subsequent actions: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Using our simple logic app scenario that polls data from a SQL table, adds the data in another table, and updates the data.
trans-unit.target: Using our simple logic app scenario that polls data from a SQL table, adds the data in another table, and updates the data.

trans-unit.source: To use the SQL Connector as an action, enter the name of the Tables and/or Stored Procedures you entered when you created the SQL Connector:
trans-unit.target: To use the SQL Connector as an action, enter the name of the Tables and/or Stored Procedures you entered when you created the SQL Connector:

trans-unit.source: After your trigger (or choose 'run this logic manually'), add the SQL connector you created from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: After your trigger (or choose 'run this logic manually'), add the SQL connector you created from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: Select one of the Insert actions, like Insert Into TempEmployeeDetails (JSON):
trans-unit.target: Select one of the Insert actions, like Insert Into TempEmployeeDetails (JSON):

trans-unit.source: Enter the input values of the record to be inserted, and click on the ✓: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Enter the input values of the record to be inserted, and click on the ✓: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the gallery, select the same SQL connector you created.
trans-unit.target: From the gallery, select the same SQL connector you created.

trans-unit.source: As an action, select the Update action on the same table, like Update EmployeeDetails:
trans-unit.target: As an action, select the Update action on the same table, like Update EmployeeDetails:

trans-unit.source: Enter the input values for the update action, and click on the ✓: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Enter the input values for the update action, and click on the ✓: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can test the logic app by adding a new record in the table that is being polled.
trans-unit.target: You can test the logic app by adding a new record in the table that is being polled.

trans-unit.source: SQL Query
trans-unit.target: SQL Query

trans-unit.source: Supported
trans-unit.target: Supported

trans-unit.source: Not Supported
trans-unit.target: Not Supported

trans-unit.source: Where clause
trans-unit.target: Where clause

trans-unit.source:
• Operators: AND, OR, =, <>, <, <=, >, >= and LIKE
  • Multiple sub conditions can be combined by ‘(‘ and ‘)’
  • String literals, Datetime (enclosed in single quotes), numbers (should only contain numeric characters)
  • Should strictly be in a binary expression format, like ((operand operator operand) AND/OR (operand operator operand))*
trans-unit.target:
• Operators: AND, OR, =, <>, <, <=, >, >= and LIKE
  • Multiple sub conditions can be combined by ‘(‘ and ‘)’
  • String literals, Datetime (enclosed in single quotes), numbers (should only contain numeric characters)
  • Should strictly be in a binary expression format, like ((operand operator operand) AND/OR (operand operator operand))*

trans-unit.source:
• Operators: Between, IN
  • All built-in functions like ADD(), MAX() NOW(), POWER(), and so on
  • Math operators like *, -, +, and so on
  • String concatenations using +.
  • All Joins
  • IS NULL and IS NOT Null
  • Any numbers with non-numeric characters, like hexadecimal numbers
trans-unit.target:
• Operators: Between, IN
  • All built-in functions like ADD(), MAX() NOW(), POWER(), and so on
  • Math operators like *, -, +, and so on
  • String concatenations using +.
  • All Joins
  • IS NULL and IS NOT Null
  • Any numbers with non-numeric characters, like hexadecimal numbers

trans-unit.source: Fields (in Select query)
trans-unit.target: Fields (in Select query)

trans-unit.source:
• Valid column names separated by commas. No table name prefixes allowed (the connector works on one table at a time).
  • Names can be escaped with ‘[‘ and ‘]’
trans-unit.target:
• Valid column names separated by commas. No table name prefixes allowed (the connector works on one table at a time).
  • Names can be escaped with ‘[‘ and ‘]’

trans-unit.source:
• Keywords like TOP, DISTINCT, and so on
  • Aliasing, like Street + City + Zip AS Address
  • All built-in functions, like ADD(), MAX() NOW(), POWER(), and so on
  • Math operators, like *, -, +, and so on
  • String concatenations using +
trans-unit.target:
• Keywords like TOP, DISTINCT, and so on
  • Aliasing, like Street + City + Zip AS Address
  • All built-in functions, like ADD(), MAX() NOW(), POWER(), and so on
  • Math operators, like *, -, +, and so on
  • String concatenations using +

trans-unit.source: For advanced queries, we suggest creating a stored procedure and execute using the execute stored procedure API.
trans-unit.target: For advanced queries, we suggest creating a stored procedure and execute using the execute stored procedure API.

trans-unit.source: When using inner queries, use them within stored procedures.
trans-unit.target: When using inner queries, use them within stored procedures.

trans-unit.source: For joining multiple conditions, you can use the 'AND' and 'OR' operators.
trans-unit.target: For joining multiple conditions, you can use the 'AND' and 'OR' operators.

trans-unit.source: This step is required only if you are using SQL Server on-premises behind your firewall.
trans-unit.target: This step is required only if you are using SQL Server on-premises behind your firewall.

trans-unit.source: App Service uses the Hybrid Configuration Manager to connect securely to your on-premises system.
trans-unit.target: App Service uses the Hybrid Configuration Manager to connect securely to your on-premises system.

trans-unit.source: If you're connector uses an on-premises SQL Server, the Hybrid Connection Manager is required.
trans-unit.target: If you're connector uses an on-premises SQL Server, the Hybrid Connection Manager is required.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Using the Hybrid Connection Manager</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Using the Hybrid Connection Manager</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
